To alter the price because it is not in proper relation to wheat is to ignore the facts of costs of production^ fcpon which the prices in the Bill are fixed,5. To fix without said evidence an arbitrary figureat this stage would be regarded aw3 a breach of faithu Apart from Its political effect, it would have the worst possible effect on british farming.
